meanings.sent1: The martinet at the school made sure all the students followed the rules.
meanings.sent2: The new manager was a real martinet, always checking everyone's work.
meanings.sent3: The martinet in charge of the office had a ruler to measure how straight the papers were aligned.
meanings.sent4: She was a martinet when it came to time management, never allowing a minute to be wasted.
meanings.sent5: The martinet's presence in the room was enough to make everyone sit up straight and pay attention.

meanings.definition: A person who demands strict adherence to rules and regulations.
meanings.sent1: The martinet in the group project insisted on following the guidelines to the letter.
meanings.sent2: As a martinet, he expected everyone to be on time for the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The martinet of the family always made sure everyone finished their chores before dinner.
meanings.sent4: She was a martinet when it came to safety, always reminding others to wear their seat belts.
meanings.sent5: The martinet's insistence on punctuality was well-known among the team members.

meanings.definition: To enforce strict discipline or obedience.
meanings.sent1: The coach would martinet the team into shape before the big game.
meanings.sent2: She had to martinet her dog to stop jumping on the furniture.
meanings.sent3: He tried to martinet the unruly class into silence, but it was a tough task.
meanings.sent4: The sergeant would martinet the recruits during training to prepare them for battle.
meanings.sent5: The teacher had to martinet the students to focus on their assignments.
